description: Demolition of existing school buildings and redevelopment of the site to provide 82 residential dwellings (31 one  bed and 51 two  bed units) in new buildings ranging from three to seven storeys in height, arranged around a central landscaped area.
decision_conditions:
CONDITION:  Prior to the commencement of development and after the tree pruning has been completed, the existing trees in the footway and the Hornbeam that is to be retained on site should be protected by 1.8 high sterling board hoarding in line with the guidance given in British Standard 5837, Trees in Relation to Construction.  The tree protection zone (i.e. distance from the branches of the tree to where this hoarding is place) shall be agreed with the Local Planning Authority in advance and in writing.  Any scaffolding requirements within this protection should be  constructed without further damaging the trees.

REASON:  To protect the trunk, branches and immediate rooting zone of the existing tree, in accordance with policy Env.6 of the Islington Unitary Development Plan (2002).
